name: colorado
sentence: As a general rule, an increase in altitude results in a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

name: colorado
sentence: Northeastern, eastern and southeastern Colorado are primarily the high plains, while northern Colorado is a mixture of high plains, foothills and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The northwest and west of Colorado are mostly mountainous, with a few mixed desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mixture of desert and mountainous areas.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen climate classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually 15-25 inches (380-640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sun and cool and light nights, which gives this region a large range of average daytime temperature.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable since the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, the thermal radiation being not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a shadow of precipitation due to its presence on the lee side of the Rockies.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this area may have several days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: In the plains, winter hollows typically range from 25 to -10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation falls during the growing season, from April to September, but this region is highly prone to droughts.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and major snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, the winters tend to be more or less dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: Mars is the most snowy month in most of the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The months of April and May are normally the wettest, while April is the wettest overall.

name: colorado
sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter because of the Chinook wind that warms the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The average July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean January temperature is 18°F (−8°C) in the morning and 48°F (9°C) in the afternoon, although variations between consecutive days may be 40°F (20°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there are a wide variety of climate types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart can experience a totally different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate that is no different from the eastern plains, which changes to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also microclimates in local areas that cover almost the full range of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant part of the extreme weather conditions occur in the less populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in the spring and summer, but are usually short.

name: colorado
sentence: The hail is a common view in the mountains east of Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most frequently reported serious weather hazard for the warm season and occasionally causes human injury, as well as significant material damage.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are subject to some of the greatest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Examples include the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most expensive in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some of the harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town in 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in supercell storms or from less intense lands, such as in the Denver Convergence Vorticity Zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Significant examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976 and the Colorado flood in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common in summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's 1901 record for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record by almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado is very dry, with the average condition of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year at the state level.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely goes through a time when part of it is not to some extent drought.

name: colorado
sentence: The lack of rainfall contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the Hayman fire in 2002.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire and the June 2012 High Park Fire and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, the Cameron Peak fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, which are the three largest fires in Colorado's history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of Colorado's mountainous regions receive a high amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melting of these snows often causes large flows of water in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, towns and cities in southwestern New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A large amount of water is also diverted for use in California; sometimes (formerly naturally and regularly) water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 in Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous terrain, Colorado is relatively calm from the seismic point of view.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States National Earthquake Information Centre is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 22, 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 km west and south-west of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second earthquake in Colorado history.

name: colorado
sentence: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was registered in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: At the beginning of the morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes swept the state of Colorado from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Amerindians for more than 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site in Larimer County contains artifacts from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern tip of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples in the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The ancient Pueblo peoples lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the southern Rocky Mountains and the western Rocky Mountains, even east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and Comanches also lived in the eastern and southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt through the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its New Mexico province before American involvement in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim east of the Rockies with the purchase of Louisiana in France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim was in conflict with Spain's claim to the upper basin of Arkansas as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led a US Army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish riders in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States waived its rights to all lands south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain with the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty took effect on 22 February 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri to the Union as the State of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri territory, including what will become northeastern Colorado, becomes unorganized territory and will remain unorganized for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the Treaty of Cordoba signed on 24 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Adams-On Treaty in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texian revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that eventually broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico surrendered its northern territory to the United States with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers traveling west to Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and the Sweetwater River to the South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extralegal state of Desertet, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the northwestern claims of Texas into a new state and two new territories, the State of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, American Mexican settlers from the Taos region settled the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the United States Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, the Kansas Territory and the Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as the Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled the animosity between the free soil and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: Gold seekers organized the Provisional Government of Jefferson's territory on 24 August 1859, but this new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on November 6, 1860, led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, the Republican-dominated Congress quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory and its gold mining areas as unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, the outgoing President of the United States, James Buchanan, signed an Act of Congress organizing the Free Territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The initial limits of Colorado remain unchanged, except for changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was commonly believed that the Colorado River was native to the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the area knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river wore mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the U.S. Army led by Captain John Macorb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macob party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to launch the American Civil War.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold seekers appreciated Confederation, the vast majority of them remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a cavalry force from Texas invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The goal of this Western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force hastily organized by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Col Glorieta, New Mexico Territory, to try to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On 28 March, the Coloradans and local volunteers of New Mexico stopped the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and fuel wagons, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to withdraw to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the food of their campaign and found little support in New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation has made no further attempts to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington Colonel of Colorado Volunteers with an order to protect the white settlers of the Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of stealing cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho who were camping along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops had killed over 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the deaths were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators have ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some remained and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the Col de l'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific railway laid its tracks westward to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the Promontory summit in Utah on May 10, 1869, to form the first transcontinental railway.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver Pacific Railway reached Denver in June the following year, and Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872 rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Utes were removed from the San Juan the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation specifying the conditions for Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysse S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th State and earned it the name "State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a large lode of silver near Leadville in 1878 triggered the Colorado silver boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and the last gold strike in Colorado, but the most important one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold researchers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on 7 November 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men from Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Buy Act in 1893 resulted in a horrific collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, the Denver floriculture industry became an important industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period is known locally as the Gold Rush of the Carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors of 1903-1904 and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The coal war of 1913-1914 and the streetcar strike of Denver in 1920 brought in the federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in six strikers killed as a result of a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since records were officially collected following an accident in Crested Butte that killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a major political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population first exceeded a million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a major wave of immigration after the Second World War stimulated Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the national economy, and high technology has become an important economic engine.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Navy warships were named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the Civil War and later in the Asian squadron, where he was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honor of the state, including the USColorado warship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base of San Diego, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in a significant contamination of plutonium in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Grey Wolf (Canis lupus) of Colorado in the 1930s, a pack of wolves has recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51% since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous city and capital in Colorado, is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and lies within the Front Range urban corridor, which has about five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest-growing counties are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The centre of Colorado's population is located just north of the village of Critchell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Colorado's population was 5,029,196.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the State population is as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples, regardless of race, represented 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's major ancestry groups are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People of German origin are particularly numerous in the Front Range, in the Rocky Mountains (central-west counties) and in the eastern/high plains areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexican-American, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the smaller towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of hispanos, descendants of the first settlers of Spanish colonial origin.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2% Hispanic and 90.3% non-Hispanic white.

name: colorado
sentence: In recent decades, Colorado's Hispanic population has continued to grow rapidly.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22% of Colorado's population, while non-Hispanic whites accounted for 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: The English spoken in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities located in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other parts of Eastern Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a large number of Asian-Americans of Mongolian origin, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southeast Asian and Japanese.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is considered more liberal and diverse than most states in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: A total of 70,331 births took place in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (Average rate of 14.6 per thousand)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1 per cent of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and someone of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth in which at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado was the seventh largest percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 persons, or approximately 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: As a percentage, Colorado is the sixth highest among Mexicans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population under one year of age were minorities, which means that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: The births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnic origin and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado recorded the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the reduction in the number of pregnancies.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language spoken in Colorado after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a native coloradan language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic, Ute.

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the population of Colorado are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Roman Catholics, 3% Mormons and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breakdowns include: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Non-affiliated individuals account for 29% of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations according to the number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630, the non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981, and the Church of Jesus Christ of the Saints of the Last Days with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest rates of obesity in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it was the lowest in the country, it had fallen from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, people in Colorado had a life expectancy of 80.21 years, the longest of all American states.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions were shot on site in Colorado, particularly in prominent westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in service, ghost mining towns have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of picturesque highways and mountain passes that have helped to showcase the free road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was scheduled to film the driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Good Luck Charlie television series was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Film and Television Bureau noted that more than 400 films were shot in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of movie festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwestern and Rocky cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants occupy a prominent position throughout the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named America's Foodest Town 2010 by Bon Appetit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants, and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more master sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held every June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountains region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for his steak, but now has a varied culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award winning varieties that have attracted attention from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines, as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey-based wines, Colorado wines have won national and international awards for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine regions are home to the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate guarantees hot summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two designated U.S. wine-growing areas of the Grand Valley AVA and the Western Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, a growing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Grand Valley AVA Colorado in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, close to and between the cities of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" due to its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open for cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion of marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: The government generated tax revenues, fees and licences of $194 million in 2016 on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado controls hemp in any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters in the 2012 general election, requires the Colorado State legislature to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14-184 on the oversight of Colorado's industrial hemp program was introduced for the first time and was finally signed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 7, 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: Medical use of marijuana by a patient within the following limits is lawful:

name: colorado

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a state in the northeastern U.S. state of New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2010 census, it has the highest per capita income, the human development index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island in the east, Massachusetts in the north, New York in the west, and Long Island Sound in the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford and its most populous city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history comes from the region, in the modern era, large sections of it are increasingly linked to the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River that approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of "Quononoquett (Conanicut)," a word Mohegan-Pequot for "long tidal raz".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch, who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the park and Connecticut Rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between Connecticut and Delaware, although the first large colonies were established by the English in the 1630s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a gang of supporters of the Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have established documents of the Fundamental Orders, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662, the three colonies merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a Crown colony.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state per zone, the 29th most populated, and the fourth most densely populated of the fifty states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "Constitutional State", the "Nutmeg State", the "Provisions State" and the "Country of Holy Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: It has influenced the development of the U.S. federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River and ports along Long Island Strait have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The government also has a long history of hosting the financial services industry, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered to the south by Long Island Sound, to the west by New York, to the north by Massachusetts, and to the east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The capital of the state and the fourth largest city is Hartford, and other major cities (by population) are Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a little larger than the country of Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 cities incorporated in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak in Connecticut is Mount Bear at Salisbury, in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of Connecticut, Massachusetts and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W) on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: In contrast, many coastal towns have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history – but the state does not have a direct seafront (technically speaking).

name: connecticut
sentence: The coast of Connecticut is located on Long Island Strait, an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: State access to the open Atlantic Ocean is both to the west (to the city of New York) and east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours from ocean storms, and many transatlantic vessels seek anchor within Long Island Sound when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses central government and flows into Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous metropolitan area in the state is located in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has wide regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest Litchfield Hills it includes mountains and horse farms, while in areas east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas and small towns of Connecticut in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways of the New York border to New London, then north to the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many cities in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green are usually historical visual symbols of New England cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal regions of Connecticut have been built and reconstructed over the years, and are less like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern border of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour about 4.0 km to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of disputes and temporary agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when the inhabitants of south Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, with the exception of New York, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, which contains the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border is the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, culminating with New York abandoning its claim to the area, whose inhabitants considered themselves to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield on the Massachusetts border, as well as the undisputed claim in Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the Quinebaug and Shetucket River Valley National Heritage Corridor and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the difficult transition zone between the southern extremity of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally has a climate characterized by cold winters with moderate snowfall and warm and wet summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and coast of Connecticut have a climate with cool winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and the long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and low East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly uniform precipitation pattern, with precipitation and snowfall spread over the entire 12-month period.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut represents an average of 56% of the possible sunshine (higher than the U.S. national average), an annual average of 2400 hours of sunshine.

name: connecticut
sentence: Early spring (April) may vary slightly cool (40s to 50s F) warm (65 to 70 F), while mid and late spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the end of May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with high means in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in the Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes heat waves of 90 to 100 °F (38 °C) occur across Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast-moving summer storms can cause short showers with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes, these thunderstorms can be severe, and the condition on average one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, remnants of tropical cyclones sometimes affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: The time generally associated with the fall season usually begins in October and lasts until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily temperatures in October and November range from the 50s to the 60s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 40s and 30s.

name: connecticut
sentence: In early October, colourful foliage began in the northern parts of the state and moved south and east to the southeast of Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, the southern and coastal regions have more oaks and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than the northern regions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the diurnal peaks are in 40°F for a large part of the state, and the mean hollows of the night are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (December to mid-March) are usually cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has high mean temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in the coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern portions of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall varies from approximately 60 inches (1,500 mm) at higher elevations in the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: In general, any community north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the state and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the low record is −32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943 and Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests in the northeastern part of Oak in the southern regions of the state, in the high forests of New England and Acadia in the northwestern part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The mountain laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the flower of the state and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the Eastern Highlands of Connecticut and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides) is found in wetlands in the southern part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the word Mohegan-Pequot, which was translated as "long tidal river" and "long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by many Amerindian tribes that can be grouped into the Nipmuc, the Sequins or the "River Indians" (which included the Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset and Quinnipiac), the Mattabesec or the "Wolf Confederation" and the Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut

sentence: The Dutch fur traders then sailed on the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford, which they called "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut colony was originally a number of distinct, smaller settlements in Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers came in 1633 and settled in Windsor, then in Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut

sentence: They were Puritans of the Massachusetts Bay colony led by Thomas Hooker, who founded the Connecticut colony at Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of Quinnipiack was founded by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton and others at New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of New Haven had its own constitution called "The Basic Agreement of the New Haven Colony", signed on 4 June 1639.

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonial colonies of historic significance are Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641) and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first major conflict between settlers and Amerindians in New England.

sentence: The Pequots reacted with increasing aggression against colonial settlements in their territory, while simultaneously taking land from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers responded to a murder in 1636 by raiding a village of Pequot on Block Island; the Pequots besieged the Saibrook Colony garrison that fall, and then attacked Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers declared war on the Pequots, organized a group of militias and allies of the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a Pequot village on the Mystic River, with estimates of deaths ranging from 300 to 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After having suffered another major loss in a battle at Fairfield, the Pequots demanded a truce and conditions of peace.

name: connecticut

sentence: In 2012, after New York City, Connecticut residents had the second highest government and local government tax rate, or 12.6 per cent of income compared to the national average of 9.9 per cent, as reported by the Fiscal Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut had an income tax system exclusive to investments.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the United States, without any deduction for costs associated with the production of investment income, such as interest on loans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed to a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equalized to the maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; as of 2019, Fairfield County was the seat of 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, with additional amounts payable in the instalment.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to state tax even if they are earned outside the state.

sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this means that Connecticut residents who work in New York do not have any Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut allows for a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but since residents working in other states are still subject to Connecticut's income tax, they may be liable for taxes if the jurisdictional credit does not fully offset Connecticut's tax amount.

name: connecticut

sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least populated of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years, Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered part of Oregon, a disputed area between the United States and the British Empire.

sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate territory from Idaho was only organized in 1863, instead of being included for periods in the Oregon and Washington territory.

sentence: Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on July 3, 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Northwest Pacific (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographical and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains", but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name appeared to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint the Colorado Territory region instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time that decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been appointed according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho

name: idaho

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity and precipitation are at their maximum.

name: idaho

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less pronounced in the eastern part of the state where rainfall is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

sentence: "Illinois" is the modern spelling of the name of the first French Catholic missionaries and explorers for the Amerindians of Illinois, a name that was written in various ways in the earliest records.

name: illinois
sentence: The name "Illinois" is derived from the verb Miami-Illinois irenwe·wa—"he speaks regularly".

name: illinois
sentence: This was taken in the Ojibwe language, perhaps in the Ottawa dialect, and changed into Ilinwe (pluralized as Ilinwe·k).

sentence: The French borrowed these forms, writing the /we/ finishing as -ois, a transliteration of this sound in French of the time.

sentence: Nauvoo was the place of the crisis of succession, which led to the separation of the Mormon movement into several holy sects of the Day of the Lauriers.

name: illinois
sentence: The Church of Jesus Christ of the Last Days Saints, the largest sect to emerge from the Mormon schism, now has more than 55,000 members in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has a large number of adherents from other abrahamic denominations.

name: illinois
sentence: Widely concentrated in the Chicago metropolitan area, adherents of the Muslim, Baha'i and Jewish religions all call the state house.

name: illinois
sentence: Muslims constitute the largest non-Christian group, with 359,264 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the largest concentration of Muslims per state in the country, with 2,800 Muslims per 100,000 citizens.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest and oldest Bahá'í worship house in the world is located in Wilmette, Illinois.The Chicago area has a very large Jewish community, especially in the suburbs of Skokie, Buffalo Grove, Highland Park and surrounding suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: The former mayor of Chicago Rahm Emanuel is the first Jewish mayor of Windy City.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also home to a large population of Hindus, Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists.

name: illinois
sentence: The Baha'i House of Worship in Wilmette is the centre of this religion's worship in North America.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's gross domestic product in dollars was estimated at US$909 billion in 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: The Government's gross domestic product per capita in 2019 was estimated at approximately $72,000.

name: illinois
sentence: As of February 2019, the unemployment rate in Illinois was 4.2%.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's minimum wage will increase to $15 per hour in 2025, making it one of the highest in the nation.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's main agricultural products are corn, soybeans, pigs, cattle, dairy products and wheat.

name: illinois
sentence: In most years, Illinois is either the first or second state for the highest soybean production, with a harvest of 427.7 million bushels (11.64 million tonnes) in 2008, after Iowa's production of 444.82 million bushels (12.11 million tonnes).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks second in U.S. corn production with more than 1.5 billion bushels produced each year.

name: illinois
sentence: With a production capacity of 1.5 billion gallons per year, Illinois is one of the largest ethanol producers, ranking third in the United States in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in food production and meat processing.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicago may no longer be "Hog Butcher for the World", the Chicago region remains a global centre for food manufacturing and meat processing, with many factories, processing houses and distribution facilities concentrated in the former Union Stock Yards area.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also produces wine, and the state is home to two American wine regions.

name: illinois
sentence: In the area of the Meeting of the Great Rivers Scenic Byway, peaches and apples are grown.

name: illinois
sentence: The German agricultural immigrants who settled in Illinois in the middle and late 19th centuries were partly responsible for the profusion of fruit orchards in this area of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's universities are actively studying alternative agricultural products as alternative crops.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the leading manufacturers in the country, with annual productivity of over $107 billion in 2006.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2011, Illinois was ranked fourth most productive manufacturing state in the country, behind California, Texas and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately three-quarters of the state's manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return area, with 38 percent of the approximately 18,900 Illinois manufacturing plants located in Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, Illinois's major value-added manufacturing industries were chemical manufacturing ($18.3 billion), machine manufacturing ($13.4 billion), food manufacturing ($12.9 billion), manufactured metal products ($11.5 billion), transportation equipment ($7.4 billion), plastic and rubber products ($7.0 billion), and computer and electronic products ($6.1 billion).

name: illinois
sentence: By the early 2000s, Illinois's economy had become dependent on high value-added services, such as financial commerce, higher education, law, logistics and medicine.

name: illinois
sentence: In some cases, these services are grouped around institutions that have listened to Illinois's previous economies.

name: illinois
sentence: For example, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, a global derivatives trading market, had begun its life as an agricultural futures market.

name: illinois
sentence: Other important non-manufacturing industries include publishing, tourism and energy production and distribution.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, venture capital investors funded a total of approximately $62 billion in the U.S. economy.

name: illinois
sentence: Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received about $1.1 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Similarly, in fiscal year 2016, the federal government spent $461 billion on U.S. contracts.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a net importer of energy fuels, despite large coal resources and minor oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois exports electricity, ranking fifth in electricity generation and seventh in electricity consumption.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois coal industry originated in the mid-19th century, when entrepreneurs like Jacob Loose discovered coal in places like Sangamon County.

name: illinois
sentence: Jacob Bunn contributed to the development of Illinois's coal industry and was the founder and owner of the Illinois Western Coal & Mining Company.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately 68% of Illinois has coal strata from the Pennsylvania geological period.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the State of Illinois Geological Survey, 211 billion tonnes of bituminous coal are estimated below the surface, having a total heating value greater than the estimated oil deposits on the Arabian Peninsula.

name: illinois
sentence: However, coal has a high sulphur content, which causes acid rain, unless special equipment is used to reduce sulphur dioxide emissions.

name: illinois
sentence: Many Illinois power plants are not equipped to burn coal with high sulphur content.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1999, Illinois produced 40.4 million tonnes of coal, but only 17 million tonnes (42%) of Illinois coal were consumed in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Most coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal and is expected to export nine million tons of coal in 2011, increasing energy demand in countries such as China, India and elsewhere in Asia and Europe.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, Illinois was ranked third among coal reserves recoverable for mine production in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states, while much of the coal burned for electricity in Illinois (21 million tonnes in 1998) is mined in Wyoming's Powder River Basin.

name: illinois
sentence: Mattoon was recently selected as a site for the Department of Energy's FutureGen project, a 275 megawatt zero-emission experimental coal-burning power plant funded by the DOE.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, after many setbacks, Mattoon withdrew from the project.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the major oil refiners in the U.S. Midwest, with a combined crude oil distillation capacity of nearly 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: illinois
sentence: However, Illinois has very limited crude oil reserves that account for less than 1% of total U.S. reserves.

name: illinois
sentence: Residential heating is 81% natural gas compared to less than 1% heating oil.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks 14th in state oil production, with a daily production of about 28,000 barrels (4,500 m3) in 2005.

name: illinois
sentence: Nuclear energy probably started in Illinois with the Chicago Pile-1, the first self-sufficient artificial reaction in the nuclear chain of the world's first nuclear reactor, built on the University of Chicago campus.

name: illinois
sentence: Six nuclear power plants are operating in Illinois: Braidwood, Byron, Clinton, Dresden, LaSalle and Quad Cities.

name: illinois
sentence: With the exception of the Clinton one-unit plant, each of these facilities has two reactors.

name: illinois
sentence: Three reactors have been permanently closed and are in various stages of decommissioning: Dresden-1 and Zion-1 and 2.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked first in 2010 in both nuclear capacity and nuclear production.

name: illinois
sentence: The production of its nuclear power plants accounted for 12 per cent of the nation's total.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 48% of Illinois's electricity was generated from nuclear power.

name: illinois
sentence: Operation Morris is the only de facto high-level radioactive waste storage site in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is increasingly interested in the use of wind energy to generate electricity.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of Illinois was classified in 2009 as "marginal or equitable" for wind power production by the U.S. Department of Energy, and some western sections were classified as "good" and parts of the south were classified as "poor".

name: illinois
sentence: These ratings apply to wind turbines with a hub height of 50 metres (160 feet); the more recent wind turbines are higher, allowing them to reach stronger winds farther from the ground.

name: illinois
sentence: As a result, other areas of Illinois have become potential wind farm sites.

name: illinois
sentence: In September 2009, Illinois had 1116.06 MW of installed wind power and an additional 741.9 MW were under construction.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks ninth in the U.S. in terms of installed wind capacity and sixteenth in terms of potential capacity.

name: illinois
sentence: Large wind farms in Illinois include Twin Groves, Rail Splitter, EcoGrove and Mendota Hills.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, wind energy accounted for only 1.7 per cent of Illinois's energy production, and it was estimated that wind energy could provide 5 to 10 per cent of the state's energy needs.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the Illinois General Assembly mandated in 2007 that by 2025, 25% of all electricity generated in Illinois would come from renewable resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks second in corn production in the United States, and Illinois corn is used to produce 40% of the ethanol consumed in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Archer Daniels Midland in Decatur, Illinois is the world's leading producer of ethanol from corn.

name: illinois
sentence: The National Corn-to-Ethanol Research Center (NCERC), the world's only institution dedicated to research on how to convert corn to ethanol, is located on the campus of Edwardsville University in southern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is one of the partners of the Energy Biosciences Institute (EBI), a $500 million biofuel research project funded by the oil giant BP.

sentence: The tax is collected by the Illinois Department of Revenue.

name: illinois
sentence: Public income tax is calculated by multiplying the net income by a flat rate.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1990, this rate was set at 3 per cent, but in 2010, the General Assembly voted for a temporary increase in the rate to 5 per cent; the new rate came into effect on 1 January 2011; the personal income rate came to a partial end on 1 January 2015 at 3.75 per cent, while corporate income tax fell to 5.25 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois did not adopt a budget from 2015 to 2017, after the 736-day budget impasse, a budget was adopted in Illinois after legislators overturned Governor Bruce Rauner's veto, raising the personal income rate to 4.95% and the corporate rate to 7%.

name: illinois
sentence: There are two rates for the government's sales tax: 6.25% for general goods and 1% for eligible food, drugs and medical devices.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is a major source of tax revenue for taxing districts of local governments.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is a local, not a state, tax imposed by the taxing districts of local governments, which include counties, cantons, municipalities, school districts and special tax districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax in Illinois is imposed only on real property.

name: illinois
sentence: On May 1, 2019, the Illinois Senator voted in favour of a constitutional amendment that would have been struck by the Illinois Constitution requiring a fixed tax on state income, by a vote of 73 to 44.

name: illinois
sentence: Had it been approved, the amendment would have allowed the state legislator to impose a progressive income tax based on annual income.

name: illinois
sentence: The Governor, J.B. Pritzker, approved the law on May 27, 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: It was planned for a general election in 2020 and required the approval of 60 per cent of electors to effectively change the constitution of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The amendment was not approved by Illinoisers, with 55.1% voting "No" at approval and 44.9% voting "Yes".

name: illinois
sentence: In 2017, Chicago had the highest sales tax rate for an American city with a population of more than 200,000, at 10.250%.

name: illinois
sentence: The state of Illinois has the second highest real estate tax rate: 2.31%, the second highest in New Jersey at 2.44%.

name: illinois
sentence: Toll roads are a user tax for citizens and visitors to the state of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks seventh out of the 11 states with the most kilometers of toll lanes, 282.1 miles.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago ranks fourth among America's most expensive toll roads per kilometre, with the Chicago Skyway paying 51.2 cents per mile.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has the 11th highest gasoline tax per state, at 37.5 cents per gallon.

Grant Homes, both in Galena and the Chanute Air Museum, located on the former Chanute Air Base in Rantoul.

sentence: The Chicago metropolitan area also houses two zoos: Brookfield Zoo, located about ten miles west of downtown Brookfield, contains more than 2300 animals and covers 216 acres (87 ha).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in music education, having hosted the Midwest Clinical International Band and Orchestra Conference since 1946, as well as the head office of the Illinois Music Educators Association (IMEA), one of the country's largest professional music educators organizations.

sentence: Chicago, in the northeast corner of the state, is an important centre for music in the west-central United States where distinctive blues (very responsible for the future creation of rock and roll) and home music, a genre of electronic dance music, have been developed.

name: illinois
sentence: The great migration of poor black workers from the south to industrial cities brought traditional jazz and blues music to the city, resulting in the blues of Chicago and "Chicago-style" Dixieland jazz.

sentence: Famous blues artists include Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Howlin' Wolf and both Sonny Boy Williamsons; great jazz includes Nat King Cole, Gene Ammons, Benny Goodman and Bud Freeman.

sentence: In the early 1930s, evangelical music began to gain popularity in Chicago thanks to contributions by Thomas A. Dorsey to the Baptist church Pilgrim.

sentence: In the 1980s and 1990s heavy rock, punk and hip-hop also became popular in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago orchestras include the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, the Chicago Lyric Opera and the Chicago Sinfonietta.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the places in his films include Glenbrook North, the former Maine North High School, the Ben Rose House in Highland Park, and the famous Home Alone house in Winnetka, Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Like one of the major cities in the United States, all major sports leagues have teams headquartered in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The state has 13 athletic programs that compete in NCAA Division I, the highest level of university sport in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: The two most prominent are Illinois Fighting Illini and Northwestern Wildcats, both members of the Big Ten Conference and the only participants in one of the so-called Power Five conferences.

sentence: The Fighting Illini football team won five national championships and three Rose Bowl games, while the men's basketball team won 17 conference seasons and played five four finals.

name: illinois
sentence: Meanwhile, the Wildcats won eight football championships and one Rose Bowl match.

sentence: The Northern Illinois Huskies of DeKalb, Illinois, competed in the Mid-American Conference winning four conference championships and winning an offer in the Orange Bowl with the production of candidate Heisman Jordan Lynch in the quarterback.

sentence: The Huskies are the only other state team competing in the Football Bowl Subdivision, the best level of NCAA football.

sentence: Four schools have football programs that participate at the second level of Division I, the Football Championship Subdivision.

name: illinois
sentence: The State of Illinois Redbirds (Normal, adjacent to Bloomington) and the Salukis of southern Illinois (the latter representing the principal campus of the University of Southern Illinois in Carbondale) are members of the Missouri Valley Conference (MVC) for non-football sports and the Missouri Valley Football Conference (MVFC).

sentence: The Loyola Ramblers, whose main campus overlaps the Edgewater and Rogers Park community areas on the north side of the city, are participating in the MVC.

sentence: The Flames of the UIC, on the near-west side next to the loop, are in the Horizon League.

name: illinois
sentence: The Cougars of Chicago State, on the south side of the city, competed at the Western Athletic Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: Finally, two non-football division I programs are located in the lowest state.

sentence: The Bradley Braves (Peoria) are members of the MVC, and the SIU Edwardsville Cougars (in the Metro East region through the Mississippi of St. Louis) participate in the CVO.

sentence: An NBA expansion team known as Chicago Packers in 1961-1962 and Chicago Zephyrs the following year moved to Baltimore after the 1962-1963 season.

name: illinois
sentence: Franchise is now known as the Washington Wizards.

sentence: The Peoria Chiefs and Kane County Cougars are minor league baseball teams affiliated with the MLB.

name: illinois
sentence: The Schaumburg Boomers and Lake County Fielders are members of the North American League and the Southern Illinois Miners, Gateway Grizzlies, Joliet Slamers, Windy City ThunderBolts and Normal CornBetters belong to the Frontier League.

sentence: Peoria Rivermen's second incarnation played in SPHL.

name: illinois
sentence: Oval race tracks at Chicagoland Speedway in Joliet, Chicago Motor Speedway in Cicero and Gateway International Raceway in Madison, near St. Louis, hosted NASCAR, CART and IRL races, while the Sports Car Club of America, among other national and regional road racing clubs, visited the Autobahn Country Club in Joliet, the Blackhawk Farms Raceway in Beloit South and the former Meadowdale International Raceway in Carpentersville.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has many short tracks and dragstrips.
