sentence: The drag track at Gateway International Raceway and Route 66 Raceway, which is located on the same property as the Chicagoland Speedway, both hosts of the NHRA drag races.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois offers several golf courses, such as Olympia Fields, Medinah, Midlothian, Cog Hill and Conway Farms, which often hosted the BMW, Western Open and Women's Western Open Championships.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the State hosted 13 editions of the U.S. Open (last in the Champs d'Olympia in 2003), six editions of the PGA Championship (last in Medina in 2006), three editions of the U.S. Women's Open (last in the Club of Merit), the 2009 Solheim Cup (in Rich Harvest Farms) and the 2012 Ryder Cup (in Medinah).

name: illinois
sentence: The John Deere Classic is a regular PGA Tour event played in Quad Cities since 1971, while the Encompass Championship has been a Champions Tour event since 2013.

name: illinois
sentence: Previously, the LGGA State Farm Classic was an event on the LPGA circuit from 1976 to 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's system of state parks began in 1908 with what is now Fort Massac State Park, becoming the first park in a system of more than 60 parks and roughly the same number of recreational and wildlife areas.

name: illinois
sentence: Areas protected by the National Parks Service include the Illinois and Michigan Canal National Heritage Corridor near Lockport, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Lincoln Home National Historic Site in Springfield, the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, the Tears National Historic Trail, the American Discovery Trail, and the Pullman National Monument.

name: illinois
sentence: The federal government is also managing the national forests of Shawnee and Midewin National Tallgrass Prairie.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government, under the Illinois Constitution, has three branches of government: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is divided into several state-wide elective positions, with the governor as the head of the executive branch.

name: illinois
sentence: Legislative functions are entrusted to the Illinois General Assembly.

name: illinois
sentence: The judiciary is composed of the Supreme Court and the lower courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois General Assembly is the state's legislative assembly, consisting of 118 members of the Illinois House of Representatives and 59 members of the Illinois Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: The members of the General Assembly shall be elected at the beginning of each year.

name: illinois
sentence: The Compiled Statutes of Illinois (ILCS) are consolidated statutes of a general and permanent nature.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch consists of six elected members and their offices, as well as many other departments.

name: illinois
sentence: The six elected members are the Governor, the Lieutenant Governor, the Attorney General, the Secretary of State, the Controller and the Treasurer.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government has many departments, agencies, boards and commissions, but the so-called code services provide most government services.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois judiciary is the unified justice system of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: It consists of the Supreme Court, the Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Supreme Court oversees the administration of the judiciary.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's administrative divisions are counties, townships, police stations, cities, towns, villages and specialized districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The 102 counties constitute the base subdivision of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Eighty-five of the 102 counties are in turn divided into cantons and electoral districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Municipal governments are cities, villages and cities incorporated.

name: illinois
sentence: Some communities have a membership rule, which allows them to govern themselves to some extent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a democrat bastion.

name: illinois
sentence: Historically, Illinois was a political swing state, with a quasi-parity between republican and democratic parties.

name: illinois
sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party gained ground and Illinois became a strong "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

name: illinois
sentence: The voices of Chicago and most Cook counties have long been highly democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: However, "collar counties" (the suburbs surrounding Cook County, Illinois) may be considered moderate electoral districts.

name: illinois
sentence: College cities such as Carbondale, Champaign, and Normal also meagre democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: Republicans continue to prevail in rural areas of northern and central Illinois, as well as in southern Illinois outside of eastern St. Louis.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1920 to 1972, Illinois was won by the winner of each of the 14 presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: In fact, the state has long been regarded as a national viewpoint, supporting the winner in every election of the 20th century, with the exception of 1916 and 1976.

name: illinois
sentence: On the other hand, Illinois moved more towards the Democratic Party and voted for their presidential candidates in the last six elections; in 2000, George W. Bush became the first Republican to win the presidency without either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: A local politician and a Chicago resident, Barack Obama, easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the votes.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, incumbent Governor Pat Quinn was re-elected with 47% of the vote, while Republican Mark Kirk was elected to the Senate with 48% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2012, President Obama easily brought Illinois back, with 58% to the Republican candidate Mitt Romney 41%.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner beat Governor Quinn from 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic Senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton increased Illinois with 55% of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth beat incumbent Mark Kirk 54% to 40%.

name: illinois
sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican candidates to win without carrying Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2018, Democratic JB Pritzker defeated Bruce Rauner for governorship with 54% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: State politics has been infamous for cases of highly visible corruption, as well as for cross-formers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, former Governor George Ryan was convicted of racketeering and corruption, resulting in a sentence of six and a half years' imprisonment.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Governor Rod Blagojevich received a criminal complaint of corruption, following allegations that he had conspired to sell the seat of Senator left by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

name: illinois
sentence: Subsequently, on 7 December 2011, Rod Blagojevich was sentenced to 14 years in prison on these counts, as well as to perjury while testifying in the case, i.e. 18 convictions.

name: illinois
sentence: Blagojevich was indicted and condemned by the legislature, forcing him to leave office.

name: illinois
sentence: At the end of the 20th century, MP Dan Rostenkowski was imprisoned for mail fraud; former Governor and Federal Judge Otto Kerner, Jr. was imprisoned for corruption; Secretary of State Paul Powell was investigated and found to have gained great wealth through bribes; and the Auditor of State for Public Accounts (Controller) Orville Hodge was imprisoned for embezzlement.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1912 William Lorimer, the boss of the Chicago GOP, was expelled from the US Senator for corruption and in 1921 Governor Len Small was found to have swindled the state of a million dollars.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois demonstrated a strong presence in the presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as their political basis when they came to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant and, more recently, Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky but moved to Illinois at the age of 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He sat in the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

name: illinois
sentence: Ulysse S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that prevented him from settling, but on the eve of the civil war and as the Middle Ages approached, he moved to Illinois and thus used the state as his home and political base to run for office.

name: illinois
sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school, and later represented Illinois in the US Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became President in 2008, running as a candidate for his Illinois base.

name: illinois
sentence: Ronald Reagan was born in Illinois, in the town of Tampico, raised in Dixon, Illinois, and studied at Eureka College, outside Peoria.

name: illinois
sentence: Reagan later settled in California during his early adulthood.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became an actor, then governor of California before being elected president.

name: illinois
sentence: Hillary Clinton was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago and became the first woman to represent a major political party in the general election of the U.S. presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Clinton left a platform based in New York.

name: illinois
sentence: Nine African-Americans sat in the Senate of the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Three of them represented Illinois, the most of all states: Carol Moseley-Braun, Barack Obama and Roland Burris, who was appointed to replace Obama after his election to the presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Moseley-Braun is the first African American woman to become American

name: illinois
sentence: Senator.

name: illinois
sentence: Three Illinois families played a particularly important role in the Democratic Party, winning both in the state as a whole and nationally.

name: illinois
sentence: The Stevenson family, initially rooted in central Illinois and later based in the Chicago metropolitan area, provided four generations of Illinois agents.

name: illinois

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Education Council (ISBE) is autonomous from the Governor and the legislature of the state, and manages public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts administer individual public schools, but the ISBE checks the performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

sentence: ISBE also makes recommendations to State leaders on education spending and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for children aged 7 to 17 in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are generally, but not exclusively, divided into three levels of primary and secondary education: primary, secondary or secondary school and secondary school.

name: illinois
sentence: District territories often have complex structures.

name: illinois

name: illinois

name: illinois
sentence: A given secondary school may have several elementary districts that feed on it, but some of these foster districts may themselves feed in several high school districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criterion established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Education, there are eleven "national universities" in the State.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is consistently ranked as one of the top ten universities in the world on various independent academic rankings, and its Booth School of Business, as well as the Kellogg School of Management in Northwestern, are consistently ranked in the top five business colleges in the country and top ten in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of August 19, 2010, six of them rank "first level" among the top 500 national universities in the country, according to the rankings of the US News & World Report: University of Chicago, University of Northwestern, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, University of Loyola Chicago, Illinois Institute of Technology, University of DePaul, University of Illinois at Chicago, University of Illinois, University of Southern Illinois Carbondale and University of Northern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has more than twenty other four-year-old accredited universities, both public and private, as well as dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges in Illinois's community college system.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois schools are funded primarily by property tax, based on the assessment of land values by the state, rather than by direct contributions from the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Tracy Steffes described Illinois's public education as historically "inequitable", a system where one of the "richest states" is "the smartest in its support for education."There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt took place in 1973 with the adoption of Illinois's resource equalization formula, a measure that was hoped that funding could be collected and distributed more equitably to schools in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from Illinois's affluent communities to the obligation to pay for the less affluent school districts (including many Black-majority communities, produced by redline, white flight and other "soft" segregation methods) led to the abolition of formulae in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Because of its central location and proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national hub for air, automobile, rail and truck traffic.

name: illinois

name: illinois

sentence: Midway is a major hub for Southwest Airlines and serves many other carriers.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana () is an American state located in the Midwest and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th largest by region and the 17th most populated of the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and largest town is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on December 11, 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and southeast, and Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, several Aboriginal peoples lived in Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its creation as a territory, settlement patterns in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation in the eastern United States; the northernmost level of the state has been established primarily by residents of New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the states of Mid-Atlantic and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diverse economy with a gross domestic product of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with over 100,000 inhabitants and a number of small industrial towns.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana hosts professional sports teams, including the NFL's Indianapolis Colts and the NBA's Indiana Pacers.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana's name means "Indian Land," or simply "Indian Land."

name: indiana
sentence: It also originates from Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed a law to divide the Northwest Territory into two areas and named the western section of the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed enabling legislation to begin the process of establishing the state for Indiana, part of that land became the geographic area of the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: An Indiana resident is officially known as a Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is contested, but the main theory, advanced by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the South of Upland) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough peasant, or a humpland.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants of what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8,000 B.C. after melting glaciers at the end of the ice age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians are nomads who hunt large game species such as mastodons.

name: indiana
sentence: They created stone tools made of oak chips, knapping and flakes.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 B.C., covered the next phase of indigenous culture.

name: indiana
sentence: People have developed new tools and techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear points and knives, with different types of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They made stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools, and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built mounds of land and middens, which showed that settlements were becoming more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period ended at about 1500 BC, although some archaic people lived up to 700 BC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 B.C., when new cultural attributes appeared.

name: indiana
sentence: The people created ceramics and pottery and extended their plant culture.

name: indiana
sentence: A group from the beginning of the wood era called the Adena people had elegant burial rituals, with log tombs under the mounds of earth.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodlands period, the Hopewells began to develop long-distance merchandise trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Towards the end of the stage, people developed a very productive crop and agricultural adaptation, cultivating crops such as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: The timber period ended around 1000 AD.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi culture emerged, from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this stage, the inhabitants created large urban settlements designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and places defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: Concentrated settlements depend on agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One of them was Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had vast public spaces such as platform squares and mounds, where leaders lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi civilization collapsed in Indiana in the middle of the 15th century for reasons that remain obscure.

name: indiana
sentence: The historical Amerindian tribes of the region at the time of the European meeting spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included Shawnee, Miami and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: The refugee tribes of the eastern regions, including the Delawares who settled in the White and Whitewater River valleys, joined them later.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, was the first European to cross Indiana after reaching the current South Bend at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He came back the following year to learn more about the region.

name: indiana
sentence: French-Canadian fur traders soon arrived, bringing blankets, jewellery, tools, whiskey and weapons to trade hides with the Amerindians.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1702, Sieur Juchereau established the first trading post near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715 Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami in Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717 another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouiaton on the Wabash River, attempting to control the Amerindian trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732 Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trading post in Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian settlers, who had left the previous post as a result of the hostilities, returned in more numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a few years, British settlers came from the East and fought against Canadians for control of the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: The fighting between French and British settlers occurred throughout the 1750s.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's Amerindian tribes allied themselves with French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years' War).

name: indiana
sentence: With the British victory in 1763, the French were obliged to surrender to the British crown all their lands in North America east of the Mississippi River and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana tribes did not give up: they captured Fort Ouiatinon and Fort Miami during the Pontiac rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British Royal Proclamation of 1763 designated the land west of the Appalachians for Amerindian purposes and excluded the British settlers in the area, whom the Crown called "Indian territory."

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775 the American Revolutionary War began as the settlers sought British autonomy and independence.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the East Coast, but patriotic military officer George Rogers Clark called an army to help fight the British in the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won major battles and resumed Vincennes and Fort Sackville on 25 Feb. 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war Clark succeeded in cutting off British troops, who attacked the settlers in the east of the west.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often credited for changing the course of the American Revolutionary War.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British Crown transferred its rights to lands south of the Great Lakes to the new United States, including Native American lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the United States defined the Northwest Territory, which included the current Indiana area.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800 Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the rest of the lands as the Indian Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as governor of the territory, and Vincennes was established as the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the separation of Michigan territory and the formation of Illinois territory, Indiana was reduced to its current size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning with the battle of the woods fallen in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles on Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase, or war and treatment.

name: indiana
sentence: About half of the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's of Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were only completed when the Treaty of Mississippiwas in 1826 acquired the last of the American Aboriginal lands reserved in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: Portrait of the Indiana Border Around 1810: The boundary was defined by the Treaty of Fort Wayne in 1809, adding much of the southwestern lands around Vincennes and the southeastern lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to the areas along the Ohio River as part of American territory.

name: indiana
sentence: The colonies were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatnon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox, and the Vincennes settlement in the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other facilities include Clarksville (passing through Louisville), Vevay and Corydon along the Ohio River, Quaker Colony at Richmond, on the eastern border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville), on the eastern central border.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for another 15 years, and Indiana's central and northern territory remained a wilderness inhabited primarily by indigenous communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the far southeast, Clark and Dearborn, were organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: Land titles issued from Cincinnati were few.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration takes place mainly by flat boat on the Ohio River to the west, and by car paths on the Wabash/White River valleys (west) and Whitewater River (east).

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, Shawnee Tecumseh's tribe leader and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other Aboriginal tribes in the Territory to resist European colonization.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the United States authorized Harrison to launch a preventive expedition against the Tecumseh Confederation; the United States won at the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 in the Battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, the armed resistance against United States control ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the Amerindian tribes of the state were subsequently abducted west of the Mississippi River in the 1820s and 1830s after the American negotiations and the purchase of their land.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a town in the extreme south of Indiana, was named the second capital of Indiana territory in May 1813 to reduce the threat of Indian raids after the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for the establishment of a State was approved by the General Assembly of the Territory and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: Enabling legislation has been passed to allow delegates to write a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On June 10, 1816, delegates gathered in Corydon to draft the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected the first governor of the nascent state in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 11, 1816, President James Madison approved the admission of Indiana to the union as the nineteenth state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825, the state capital was moved from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants went west to settle in Indiana at the beginning of the 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest group of immigrants to settle in Indiana were the Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: Americans who were predominantly English-born migrated from northern New York and New England, as well as from the mid-Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811 and the national highway at Richmond in 1829 greatly facilitated the colonization of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: After the creation of a state, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a border into a developed, well-populated and prosperous state, with major demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the State's founders launched a program, the Indiana Mammouth Internal Improvement Act, which led to the construction of publicly funded roads, canals, railways and public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans went bankrupt and were a financial disaster but increased the land and produced more than four times the value.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and in order to avoid another one, in 1851, a second constitution was adopted.

name: indiana
sentence: Among its provisions are the prohibition of public debt, as well as the extension of the vote to African-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American civil war, Indiana gained political influence and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first Western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and Indiana soldiers participated in all major commitments of the war.

name: indiana
sentence: The state supplied 126 infantry regiments, 26 artillery batteries and 13 cavalry regiments to the Union.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana received a quota of 7,500 troops to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: So many volunteers in the first appeal that thousands of people had to be hijacked.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the war ended, Indiana had paid 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: The victims were more than 35 per cent of those men: 24,416 lost their lives and more than 50,000 were injured.

name: indiana
sentence: The only civil war conflicts in Indiana were the Newburgh Raid, a bloodless capture of the city; and the Battle of Corydon, which took place during the Morgan Raid, leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded, and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war, Indiana remains a largely agricultural state.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone mining, meat packaging, food processing, such as grain grinding, alcohol distillation, and the construction of cars, bugs, agricultural machinery and equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This has led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the beginning of the industrial revolution, Indian industry began to grow at an accelerated pace in the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers have developed trade unions and suffrage movements related to the advancement of women.

name: indiana
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, Indiana became a strong manufacturing state linked to the new automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the country's first commercially successful automotive company, operated in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis Highway and the beginning of automotive-related industries were also linked to the automotive boom.

name: indiana
sentence: During the 1930s, Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was affected by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic downturn has had a major negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline in urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further west has led many migrants to flee into the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration found it difficult to put in place a publicly funded social assistance system to help overcrowded private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During its administration, spending and taxes were drastically reduced in response to the depression, and the government of the state was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt ended the state ban and adopted the first state income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions, he declared martial law to put an end to labour strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: The Second World War helped to revive the Indiana economy, as the war required steel, food and other goods that were produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately ten per cent of Indiana's population joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries won war production contracts and began to make war equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5 per cent of all U.S. military weapons produced during the Second World War, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of the industry to meet the demands of war helped to end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: With the end of the Second World War, Indiana returned to pre-Depression production levels.

name: indiana
sentence: The industry became the main employer, a trend that continued in the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: Urbanisation in the 1950s and 1960s led to strong growth in the cities of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The automobile, steel and pharmaceutical industries dominated large Indiana companies.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million in the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s, Matthew E. Welsh's administration passed its first 2% sales tax.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were disintegrated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Office reported that the Indiana population was 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: The Welsh Governor also worked with the General Assembly to pass the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, which provides equal protection to minorities seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slipped onto an ice track on the basis of the Bunker Hill Air Force in Bunker Hill, Indiana, and caught fire during a training exercise.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were set on fire, including a thermonuclear weapon of 9 megatonnes, causing radioactive contamination of the crash zone.

name: indiana
sentence: Starting in 1970, a series of amendments to the Constitution of the State were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With the adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeal was established and the procedure for appointing judges was adjusted.

name: indiana
sentence: The 1973 oil crisis created a recession that hurt the automobile industry in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies such as Delco Electronics and Delphi have begun a long series of reductions that have contributed to high unemployment rates in the manufacturing industry in Anderson, Muncie and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The trend towards restructuring and deindustrialization continued until the 1980s, when the national and State economies began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total land and water area of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks 38th among the largest states.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has a maximum north-south dimension of 250 miles (400 kilometres) and a maximum east-east dimension of 145 miles (233 kilometres).

name: indiana
sentence: The geographic centre of the state (39° 53.7'N, 86° 16.0W) is in Marion County.

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the Midwest of the United States, Indiana is one of the eight states that make up the Great Lakes region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered north by Michigan, east by Ohio and west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana to the northwest, and the Ohio River separates Indiana from Kentucky to the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is about 760 feet (230 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County 1,257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The lowest point at 320 feet (98 m) above sea level is in Posey County where the Wabash River meets the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The resulting elevation range of 937 feet (286 m) is the narrowest of any U.S. non-coastal state.

name: indiana
sentence: Only 2850 square miles (7,400 km2) are above 1000 feet (300 m) and this area is closed in 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately 4,700 square miles (12,000 km2) have an altitude of less than 500 feet (150 m), mainly concentrated along Ohio and the lower Wabash, Tell City and Terre Haute valleys in Evansville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: The state consists of two natural regions of the United States: central lowlands and inner lower plateaus.

name: indiana
sentence: The till plains form the northern and central areas of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: A large part of its appearance is the result of elements left behind by glaciers.

name: indiana
sentence: The centre of Indiana is mostly flat with a few low hilly hills (except when rivers cut deep valleys across the plain, such as the Wabash River and Sugar Creek) and ground composed of glacial sands, gravel and clay, giving rise to exceptional agricultural land.

name: indiana
sentence: Northern Indiana is similar, with the exception of higher and more rolling terminal moraines and hundreds of kettle lakes.

name: indiana
sentence: In northwestern Indiana, there are several ridges of sand and dunes, some reaching nearly 200 feet high.

name: indiana
sentence: It extends along the Lake Michigan coastline and from the interior to the Kankakee Outwash Plain.

name: indiana
sentence: Southern Indiana is characterized by rugged, hilly valleys and terrain, contrasting with much of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Here the substrate is exposed to the surface and is not buried in the glacier to the north.

name: indiana
sentence: Because of Indiana's predominant limestone, the area has many caves, caves and quarries.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's major river systems include the Whitewater, White, Blue, Wabash, St. Joseph and Maumee rivers.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, there were 65 rivers, streams and streams of environmental interest or picturesque beauty, which included only a portion of approximately 24,000 hydrographic miles in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The Wabash River, the longest open east of Mississippi, is the official Indiana River.

name: indiana
sentence: At 475 miles (764 kilometres) long, the river bisects the state from northeast to southwest, forming part of the state border with Illinois, before converging with the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The river was the subject of several songs, such as On the Banks of the Wabash, The Wabash Cannonball and Back Home Again, In Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: There are approximately 900 lakes listed by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources.

name: indiana
sentence: In the northwest, Indiana borders Lake Michigan, one of five lakes in the Great Lakes, the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: Tippecanoe Lake, the deepest of the state, reaches depths of nearly 37 metres, while Wawasee Lake is the largest natural lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 10,750 acres (on the summer pool level), Lake Monroe is the largest lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In the past, almost all Indiana had a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm and humid summers; only the extreme south of the state was in the humid subtropical climate, which receives more precipitation than other parts of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: But as of the 2016 update, about half of the state is now classified as subtropical wet.

name: indiana
sentence: Temperatures usually vary from the north and south sections of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-winter, mean high/low temperatures vary from about 30°F/15°F (−1°C/−10°C) to the extreme north at 41°F/24°F (5°C/−4°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-summer, there is generally slightly less variation across the state, as average high/weak temperatures vary from 84°F/64°F (29°C/18°C) to the extreme north at 90°F/69°F (32°C/21°C) to the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's record temperature was 116°F (47°C) on July 14, 1936, in Collegeville.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral general assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and the circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the head of the executive of the state and has the power to administer the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections taking place at the same time as the US presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may not sit more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adjust the other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and remove the leaders of almost all departments, councils and commissions of State.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include the appeal to the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in case of emergency or disaster, the granting of pardons or commutation of the sentence of any criminal offender, except in cases of treason or indictment and in possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor is the Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by its constituents.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor shall vote only in case of need to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is charged, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of Governor and Lieutenant Governor are unoccupied, the Acting Speaker of the Senator becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly is composed of a 50-member Senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the Lower House.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative authority within the government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the senator and the house can introduce a bill, except for the fact that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each House, but both Houses must pass them before they are presented to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislature may cancel the Governor's veto by voting by a majority of the full members of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be used without exception by the entire State.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly does not have the power to create legislation for a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the state's judicial system by adjusting the size of the courts and the boundaries of their constituencies.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has exclusive authority to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court is composed of five judges with a 15-judge Court of Appeal.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects judges from the Supreme Courts and Appeal Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After serving for two years, judges must obtain the support of the electorate for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only deal with cases that have been submitted to it after having been heard by lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local district courts are the place where most cases begin with a trial and the consequences are decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has original and exclusive jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Despite its dependence on manufacturing, Indiana was less affected by the decline in traditional Rust Belt manufacturing than many of its neighbours.

name: indiana
sentence: The explanation appears to be a number of factors in the labour market.

name: indiana
sentence: First, a large part of heavy manufacturing, such as industrial machinery and steel, requires a highly skilled workforce, and companies are often willing to find where there are already skills that are difficult to train.

name: indiana
sentence: Second, Indiana's labour force is found primarily in medium-sized and smaller cities rather than in very large and expensive metropolitan areas.

name: indiana
sentence: This allows companies to offer slightly lower wages for these skills than would normally be the case.

sentence: In the 19th century, Iowa was one of the first states to promulgate prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — In Re the Matter of Ralph, rendered in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the U.S. Supreme Court banned deceit laws at the national level.

name: iowa
sentence: The Supreme Court of Iowa ruled on Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Education Board.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of additional court decisions effectively put an end to segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public housing 91 years before the Supreme Court of the United States reached the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited business discrimination: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, food counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun."

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts have chosen to strictly apply this law, allowing for the continuation of de facto discrimination.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in the State of Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their clients regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service in a Moines pharmacy.

name: iowa
sentence: Complete racial civil rights have been codified under the Iowa Civil Rights Act 1965.

name: iowa
sentence: As in the case of racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women to vote before the ratification of the nineteenth amendment to the United States Constitution in 1920, the Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, Iowa University became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first state in the Union to admit women to the practice of law, the Court ruling that women cannot be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and to admit Arabella A. Mansfield to the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to Iowa women were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

sentence: Kansas () is an American state located in the Midwest of the United States.

name: kansas
sentence: It is often said that the name of the tribe (naturally kko:ze) means "the people of the wind (south)" although it is probably not the original meaning of the term.

name: kansas
sentence: Thus, the region was a source of violence and chaos in its early days when these forces clashed, and was known as Bleeding Kansas.

sentence: The abolitionists prevailed, and on 29 January 1861 Kansas entered the Union as a free State, hence the unofficial nickname "The Free State".

sentence: In 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, corn, sorghum and soybeans.

name: kansas

sentence: The inhabitants of Kansas are called Kansans.

sentence: Mount Sunflower is the highest point in Kansas at 4,039 feet (1,231 meters).

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a continental, semi-arid and subtropical wet steppe.

name: kansas
sentence: Two thirds of the state (especially the northeastern part) has a damp continental climate, with cold cold winters and warm, often humid summers.

name: kansas
sentence: Most precipitation falls during the summer and spring.

name: kansas
sentence: The western third of the state, from the U.S. Highway 83 corridor westward, has a semi-arid steppe climate.

name: kansas
sentence: Summers are hot, often very hot and usually less humid.

name: kansas
sentence: Winters are very variable between hot and very cold.

name: kansas
sentence: The western region receives an average of 16 inches (410 millimetres) of precipitation per year.

sentence: Chinook winds in winter can warm up western Kansas to 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees Celsius).

sentence: The south-central and south-eastern portions of the state, including the Wichita region, have a humid subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, milder winters and more precipitation than elsewhere in Kansas.

sentence: Goebel is the only governor of an American state to have been murdered while in office.

sentence: The Black Patch Tobacco Wars, a vigilante action, took place in the west of Kentucky in the early 20th century.

sentence: Due to the monopoly of the tobacco industry, tobacco producers in the region were forced to sell their crops at too low prices.

sentence: Kentucky is one of the four U.S. states officially using the term commonwealth.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term was used for Kentucky as it was also used by Virginia, from where Kentucky was created.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term has no particular meaning in its meaning and has been chosen to emphasize the distinction between the status of the royal colonies as a place governed by the general well-being of the population.

name: kentucky
sentence: The Kentucky was originally referred to as the "State of Kentucky" in the law that allowed it to the union, as it was mentioned in the first Kentucky constitution.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term commonwealth was used in citizens' petitions submitted between 1786 and 1792 for the creation of the state.

name: kentucky
sentence: It was also used in the title of a state history that was published in 1834 and was used in various places in this book with reference to Virginia and Kentucky.

name: kentucky
sentence: The other three states officially referred to as "wealths" are Massachusetts, Pennsylvania and Virginia.

name: kentucky
sentence: Puerto Rico and the Northern Mariana Islands are also officially municipalities.

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky is one of five states that elect their state representatives in the odd years (the others being Louisiana, Mississippi, New Jersey and Virginia).

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky holds elections for these positions every four years in the years preceding the presidential election.

name: kentucky
sentence: For example, Kentucky held gubernatorial elections in 2011, 2015 and 2019.

name: kentucky
sentence: The Executive is headed by the Governor, who is both Head of State and Head of Government.

name: kentucky
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor may or may not have executive authority, depending on whether the person is a member of the Governor's Cabinet.

name: kentucky
sentence: Under the current Constitution of Kentucky, the Lieutenant Governor assumes the functions of Governor only if the Governor is unable to do so.

name: kentucky
sentence: (Before 1992, the Lieutenant Governor assumed power at any time when the Governor was not of the State.)

name: kentucky
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor usually hold one ticket (also under a 1992 constitutional amendment) and are elected for a four-year term.

name: kentucky
sentence: The present Governor is Andy Beshear, and the Lieutenant Governor is Jacqueline Coleman.

name: kentucky
sentence: Both are Democrats.

name: kentucky
sentence: The executive branch is composed of the following "cabinets", each headed by a secretary who is also a member of the governor's cabinet:

name: kentucky
sentence: The Cabinet system was introduced in 1972 by Governor Wendell Ford to consolidate hundreds of government entities that report directly to the Governor's office.

name: kentucky
sentence: Other elected constitutional functions include the Secretary of State, the Attorney-General, the Auditor of Public Accounts, the State Treasurer and the Commissioner for Agriculture.

sentence: At present, Republican Michael G. Adams serves as Secretary of State.

name: kentucky
sentence: The Chief Prosecutor, the law enforcement officer and the commonwealth public order officer is the Attorney General, currently Republican Daniel Cameron.

name: kentucky

sentence: The legislative power of Kentucky consists of a bicameral body called the General Assembly of Kentucky.

sentence: In November 2016, Republicans gained control of the House for the first time since 1922, and currently have supermajorities in the House and Senate.

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky's judicial branch is called the Kentucky Court of Justice and includes limited courts of jurisdiction called district courts; general courts of jurisdiction called circuit courts; specialized courts such as the Drug and Family Courts; an intermediate court of appeal, the Kentucky Court of Appeal; and a final court of appeal, the Kentucky Supreme Court.

name: kentucky
sentence: The Kentucky Court of Justice is headed by the President of the Supreme Court of the Commonwealth.

name: kentucky
sentence: In the federal justice system, Kentucky is served by two United States District Courts: the Eastern Kentucky District, with its main headquarters in Lexington, and the Western Kentucky District, with its main headquarters in Louisville.

sentence: Kentucky Laws, known as Kentucky Revised Statutes (KRS), were enacted in 1942 to better organize and clarify the entire Kentucky Act.

sentence: In addition, in 1948, the Kentucky General Assembly established the Kentucky State Police, making it the 38th state to create a force whose jurisdiction extends to the whole state.

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky is one of the 32 states in the United States that punishes the death penalty for some murders defined as heinous.

name: kentucky
sentence: Persons convicted of capital offences after 31 March 1998 are still executed by lethal injection; those convicted on or before 31 March 1998 may opt for the electric chair.

name: kentucky
sentence: Only three people have been executed in Kentucky since the United States Supreme Court reinstated the practice in 1976.

name: kentucky

name: kentucky
sentence: Irregularity with enforcement has led to it becoming the last public execution in the United States.

Mercer County case, wrote that an exhibition including the Mayflower Compact, the Declaration of Independence, the Ten Commandments, the Magna Carta, the Star-Spangled Banner, and the national motto could be erected in the Mercer County Courthouse.

sentence: Kentucky has a classified general property tax system.

sentence: All categories of property, unless exempted by the Constitution, are imposed by the State, although at very varying rates.

Maine is the only American state whose name has only one syllable.

sentence: Maine has a damp continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb), with warm and sometimes humid summers, and long, cold and very snowy winters.

sentence: The Maryland government is led in accordance with the constitution of the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts, officially known as Commonwealth of Massachusetts, is the most populous state in the New England region of the northeastern United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It borders the Atlantic Ocean to the east, the states of Connecticut and Rhode Island to the south, New Hampshire and Vermont to the north and New York to the west.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The capital of Massachusetts is Boston, which is also the most populated city in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is home to the Greater Boston metropolitan area, an area that affects American history, universities and industry.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Originally dependent on agriculture, fisheries and commerce, Massachusetts was transformed into a manufacturing centre during the industrial revolution.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the 20th century, Massachusetts' economy shifted from manufacturing to services.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Modern Massachusetts is a world leader in biotechnology, engineering, higher education, finance and maritime trade.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plymouth was the site of the second colony in New England after Popham Colony in 1607 in what is now Maine.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plymouth was founded in 1620 by the pilgrims, passengers of the Mayflowers.

sentence: In 1692, Salem and its surroundings experienced one of the most famous cases of mass hysteria in America, the Salem witch trial.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1777, General Henry Knox founded the Springfield Armory, which, during the industrial revolution, catalyzed many important technological advances, including interchangeable parts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1786 Shays' rebellion, a populist revolt led by disused American Revolutionary War veterans, influenced the United States Constitutional Convention.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the 18th century, the first great Protestant revival, which swept away Britain and the Thirteen Colonies, came from the pulpit of Northampton preacher Jonathan Edwards.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At the end of the 18th century Boston became known as "Cradle of Liberty" for its agitation that later led to the American revolution.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The whole Commonwealth of Massachusetts has played an important scientific, commercial and cultural role in the history of the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Before the American civil war, Massachusetts was a centre for abolitionist, temperance and transcendentalist movements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the late 19th century, basketball and volleyball were invented in the cities of Springfield and Holyoke, respectively, in western Massachusetts.

sentence: In 2004, Massachusetts became the first U.S. state to legally recognize same-sex marriage as a result of the Massachusetts Supreme Court decision in Goodridge v. Department of Public Health.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many prominent US political dynasties come from the state, including the Adams and Kennedy families.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard University in Cambridge is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States, with the greatest financial endowment from any university, and Harvard Law School has formed a contemporary majority of the judges of the Supreme Court of the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Kendall Square in Cambridge has been called "the most innovative square kilometre on the planet", in reference to the high concentration of entrepreneurial start-ups and the quality of innovation that have appeared near the square since 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard and MIT, also in Cambridge, were ranked among the most renowned academic institutions in the world.

sentence: Students in Massachusetts public schools are among the highest levels of academic performance in the world.

sentence: The state has been ranked as one of the best states in the U.S. for citizens to live in, as well as one of the most expensive.

name: massachusetts

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was originally inhabited by tribes of the Algonquian language family such as Wampanoag, Narragansett, Nipmuc, Pocomtuc, Mahican and Massachusett.

name: massachusetts
sentence: While cultivation of crops such as squash and corn supplemented their diet, these tribes generally depended on hunting, gathering and fishing for most of their food.

sentence: The villages consisted of lodges called wigwams and long-term houses, and the tribes were led by male or female elders called Sachems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The first English settlers of Massachusetts, the pilgrims, arrived on the Mayflower in Plymouth in 1620 and established friendly relations with the native Wampanoag.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This was the second successful permanent English colony in the part of North America that later became the United States, after the Jamestown colony.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The event is known as the "First Thanksgiving" was celebrated by pilgrims after their first harvest in the New World, which lasted three days.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Pilgrims were soon followed by other Puritans, who established the Massachusetts Bay settlement in Boston in 1630.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Puritans, who believed that the Church of England needed to be purified and was harassed by English authority because of their beliefs, came to Massachusetts to establish an ideal religious society.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Unlike the Plymouth settlement, the Bay colony was founded under a royal charter in 1629.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Both religious dissent and expansionism led to the creation of several new colonies soon after Plymouth and Massachusetts Bay elsewhere in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts Bay banished dissidents like Anne Hutchinson and Roger Williams because of religious and political disagreements.

sentence: In 1636 Williams founded the Rhode Island settlement and Hutchinson joined it several years later.

sentence: Mississippi has a humid subtropical climate with long summers, warm and humid, and short and mild winters.

sentence: Montana is a state in the northwestern part of the United States of America.

name: montana
sentence: It is bordered by Idaho to the west; North Dakota and South Dakota to the east; Wyoming to the south; and the Canadian provinces of Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan to the north.

name: montana
sentence: It is the fourth largest state per region, the eighth least populated, and the third least dense.

name: montana
sentence: The western half of Montana contains many mountain ranges, while half is characterized by prairie terrain and western badlands, with more (though smaller) mountain ranges throughout the state.

name: montana
sentence: A total of 77 designated ranges are part of the Rocky Mountains.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has no official nickname, but several unofficial ones, including "Big Sky Country", "The Treasure State", "Land of the Shining Mountains", and "The Last Best Place".

name: montana
sentence: The economy is mainly based on agriculture, including livestock and cereal production.

name: montana
sentence: Other important economic resources include oil, gas, coal, mining and timber.

name: montana
sentence: The health care, service and government sectors are also important to the government economy.

name: montana
sentence: The fastest growing area in Montana is tourism, with nearly 13 million annual visitors visiting Glacier National Park, Yellowstone National Park, Beartooth Highway, Flathead Lake, Big Sky Resort and other attractions.

name: montana
sentence: The name Montana comes from the Spanish word montaña, which in turn comes from the Latin word montanea, meaning "mountain" or more widely "mountainous country".

name: montana
sentence: Montaña del Norte is the name given by the first Spanish explorers to the whole western mountainous region.

name: montana
sentence: The name Montana was added in 1863 to a bill of the United States House Committee on Territories (then chaired by James Ashley of Ohio) for the territory that would become Idaho's territory.

name: montana
sentence: The name was changed by representatives Henry Wilson (Massachusetts) and Benjamin F. Harding (Oregon), who complained Montana had "no sense."

name: montana
sentence: When Ashley introduced a bill to establish a temporary government in 1864 for a new territory to be dug out of Idaho, he again chose the territory of Montana.

name: montana
sentence: This time, Samuel Cox, also of Ohio, opposed the name.

name: montana
sentence: Cox complained that the name was a bad name since most of the territory was not mountainous and a Native American name would be more appropriate than a Spanish name.

name: montana
sentence: Other names such as Shoshone were suggested, but the Territorial Committee decided that they could appoint it as they wished, so that the original name of Montana was adopted.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is one of eight mountain states in the northern part of the region known as the Western United States.

name: montana
sentence: It is bordered by North Dakota and South Dakota in the east.

name: montana
sentence: Wyoming is to the south, Idaho to the west and south-west, and the Canadian provinces of British Columbia, Alberta and Saskatchewan are to the north, making it the only state to border three Canadian provinces.

name: montana
sentence: With an area of 147,040 square miles (380,800 km2), Montana is slightly larger than Japan.

name: montana
sentence: It is the fourth largest state in the United States after Alaska, Texas, and California; it is the largest landlocked state.

name: montana
sentence: State topography is roughly defined by the continental division, which divides much of the state into distinct regions of the east and west.

name: montana
sentence: Most of the hundreds of mountain ranges in Montana lie in the western half of the state, most of which are geologically and geographically located in northern Rocky Mountains.

name: montana
sentence: The Absaroka and Beartooth chains in the southern central part of the state are technically part of the central Rocky Mountains.

name: montana
sentence: Approximately 60 percent of the state is a prairie, which is part of the northern Great Plains.

sentence: The Bitterroot Mountains, one of the longest continuous chains in the Alaska Mountain Range in Mexico, as well as smaller chains, including the Alene Heart Mountains and the Cabinet Mountains, divide the state of Idaho.

sentence: Nevada (Spanish: "Nevada") is a state in the United States of America.

name: nevada
sentence: It is bordered by Oregon in the northwest, Idaho in the northeast, California in the west, Arizona in the southeast, and Utah in the east.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada is the 7th largest, the 19th least populated, but the 9th least populated of the American states.

name: nevada
sentence: Almost three-quarters of Nevada's residents live in Clark County, which is home to the Las Vegas–Paradise metropolitan area, including three of the four largest incorporated cities.

name: nevada
sentence: The capital of Nevada is Carson City.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada is officially known as the "State of Money" because of the importance of money for its history and economy.

name: nevada
sentence: It is also known as the "Battle-born State" because it reached state status during the civil war (the words "born of the Battle" also appear on the flag of the State); as "born state of the Sage" for the indigenous plant of the same name; and as "born state of the Sage".

name: nevada
sentence: The name means "snow cover" in Spanish, referring to the small overlap of Nevada with the mountain range of the Sierra Nevada; however, the rest of Nevada is largely deserted and semi-arid, much of it in the Great Basin.

name: nevada
sentence: The areas south of the Great Basin are within the Mojave Desert, while Lake Tahoe and Sierra Nevada are at the western boundary.

name: nevada
sentence: Approximately 86% of state land is managed by various jurisdictions of the U.S. federal government, both civilian and military.

sentence: American Indians of the Paiute, Shoshone and Washoe tribes lived in what is now Nevada.

sentence: The first Europeans to explore the region were the Spanish.

name: nevada
sentence: They called the Nevada region (snow) because of the snow that covered the mountains in winter similar to Sierra Nevada in Spain.

name: nevada
sentence: The region is part of the Alta California territory within the Vice-Royalty of New Spain, which gained independence as Mexico in 1821.

name: nevada
sentence: The United States annexed the region in 1848 after its victory in the war between Mexico and the United States, and it was incorporated into Utah territory in 1850.

name: nevada
sentence: The discovery of money at the Comstock Lode in 1859 gave rise to a demographic boom that became an impetus for the creation of Nevada territory from the territory of western Utah in 1861.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada became the 36th state on 31 October 1864, the second of the two states to join the Union during the civil war (the first being West Virginia).

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada is known for its libertarian laws.

name: nevada
sentence: In 1940, with a population of just over 110,000, Nevada was by far the least populated state, with less than half of the next least populated state, Wyoming.

name: nevada
sentence: However, legalized play and mild marriage and divorce laws have transformed Nevada into a major tourist destination in the 20th century.

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada is the only U.S. state where prostitution is legal, although it is illegal in its most populated areas – Clark County (Las Vegas), Washoe County (Reno) and Carson City (which, as an independent city, is not within the borders of any county).

name: nevada
sentence: The tourism industry remains the largest employer in Nevada, as mining remains an important sector of the economy: Nevada is the fourth largest gold producer in the world.

sentence: The name "Nevada" comes from the Spanish Nevada [Nevada βaða], which means "covered with snow".

name: nevada
sentence: Nevada is almost entirely located in the province of the basin and the mountain chain and is divided by many north-south mountain ranges.

name: nevada
sentence: Most of these areas have endorheic valleys between them, which delusions the image represented by the term Grand Bassin.

name: nevada
sentence: Most of the northern part of the state lies in the Great Basin, a mild desert that experiences warm and cold temperatures in summer and winter.

name: nevada
sentence: Occasionally, the humidity of the Arizona monsoon will cause summer thunderstorms; Pacific storms can cover the area with snow.

name: nevada
sentence: The highest temperature recorded by the State was 125°F (52°C) at Laughlin (605 feet or 184 metres) on June 29, 1994.

sentence: Several rivers flow east of Sierra Nevada, including the Walker, Truckee, and Carson rivers.

sentence: Snake River tributaries drain the far north, while Colorado, which also forms a large part of the border with Arizona, drains much of southern Nevada.

sentence: The area receives less rain in winter, but it is closer to Arizona Monsoon in summer.
